level.text: This chapter establishes uniform requirements for transferring money or other things of value to recipients outside the District government, where the Department is authorized to make grants.
The Director of the Department of Human Services is authorized to make a grant where:
A statute authorizes the Department to support or stimulate the activity of the recipient;
The Department will not be substantially involved in the activity that is supported or stimulated; and
The Department is not acquiring any property or service of direct use to the District government.

The Department is authorized to make grants pursuant to the Vocational Rehabilitation Act of 1973 as amended; the Dwight D. Eisenhower Mathematics and Education Act of 1988; the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act of 1987 as amended; and the Community Service Block Grant Act as amended.

level.heading: AUTHORITY
level.text: Unless otherwise noted, the authority for this chapter is the Elementary and Secondary Education Act, 20 U.S.C. § 6301 et seq.; the Vocational Rehabilitation Act of 1973, 29 U.S.C. § 720 et seq.; the Community Service Block Grant Act, 42 U.S.C. § 9901 et seq.; the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act, 42 U.S.C. § 11301 et seq.; and Mayor’s Order 91-97 (June 5, 1991).
